```{r}
# Old Faithful Geyser Data - Simple Linear Regression Analysis
# Predicting waiting time from eruption duration

# Load the data
data(faithful)

# 1. Exploratory Data Analysis
# View the first few observations
head(faithful)

# Summary statistics
summary(faithful)

# 2. Create a scatterplot with regression line
plot(waiting ~ eruptions, data = faithful,
     main = "Old Faithful: Waiting Time vs Eruption Duration",
     xlab = "Eruption Duration (minutes)",
     ylab = "Waiting Time to Next Eruption (minutes)",
     pch = 16, col = "blue")

# 3. Fit the linear regression model
faithful.lm <- lm(waiting ~ eruptions, data = faithful)

# Add regression line to plot
abline(faithful.lm, col = "red", lwd = 2)

# 4. Display regression results
summary(faithful.lm)

# 5. Extract key statistics
cat("\n=== REGRESSION EQUATION ===\n")
cat(sprintf("Waiting Time = %.2f + %.2f * (Eruption Duration)\n", 
            coef(faithful.lm)[1], coef(faithful.lm)[2]))

cat("\n=== INTERPRETATION ===\n")
cat(sprintf("Slope: For each additional minute of eruption duration,\n"))
cat(sprintf("       the waiting time increases by %.2f minutes on average.\n", 
            coef(faithful.lm)[2]))
cat(sprintf("R-squared: %.2f%% of variation in waiting time is explained by eruption duration.\n",
            summary(faithful.lm)$r.squared * 100))

# 6. Check model assumptions with diagnostic plots
par(mfrow = c(2, 2))
plot(faithful.lm)
par(mfrow = c(1, 1))

# 7. Additional diagnostic plots
par(mfrow = c(1, 3))

# Residuals vs Fitted
plot(faithful.lm, which = 1, main = "Residuals vs Fitted")

# Q-Q Plot
plot(faithful.lm, which = 2, main = "Normal Q-Q Plot")

# Residuals vs Order (for independence check)
plot(residuals(faithful.lm), 
     main = "Residuals vs Order",
     xlab = "Observation Order",
     ylab = "Residuals",
     pch = 16, col = "blue")
abline(h = 0, col = "red", lty = 2)

par(mfrow = c(1, 1))

# 8. 95% Confidence Interval for the slope
cat("\n=== 95% CONFIDENCE INTERVAL FOR SLOPE ===\n")
conf_int <- confint(faithful.lm, "eruptions", level = 0.95)
cat(sprintf("We are 95%% confident the true slope is between %.2f and %.2f\n",
            conf_int[1], conf_int[2]))
```
